intro: Acinodendron simplex, commonly known as the slender acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically red or yellow when mature. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat obscure species in botanical studies.
